alert.note: Alert for Boulder And Jefferson Counties Below 6000 Feet, West Broomfield County; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 14 at 2:12PM MST until February 16 at 12:00AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO MIDNIGHT MST WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 4 and 8 inches with the highest amounts on the southwest side of the Denver metro. * WHERE...Boulder and the western suburbs of Denver, and Denver. * WHEN...From Midnight tonight to Midnight MST Wednesday Night. * IMPACTS...Snow covered roads will make travel hazardous. Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org. Roads will be slick resulting in slow and hazardous travel. Allow extra time to reach your destination. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
